name: Sarajevo
fun_fact: Fun fact: Sarajevo hosted the 1984 Winter Olympics, but just 8 years later endured the longest siege in modern warfare (1,425 days, 1992-1996). Today, the bobsled track is covered in graffiti art and the city has transformed into a symbol of resilience and reconciliation.

hero_dishes.name: Burek
hero_dishes.description: Flaky phyllo pastry spiral filled with meat (or cheese = sirnica, spinach = zeljanica)
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ottoman heritage - true burek has ONLY meat; other fillings have different names. Eaten with yogurt

hero_dishes.name: Bosanski Lonac
hero_dishes.description: Layered meat and vegetable stew slow-cooked in a clay pot for hours
hero_dishes.origin_story: Bosnia's national dish - the clay pot (lonac) cooking method dates back centuries
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Nanina Kuhinja, Dveri, traditional Bosnian restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Tufahija
hero_dishes.description: Poached apple stuffed with walnuts, soaked in sugar syrup, topped with whipped cream
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ottoman-era dessert - the walnut filling and syrup are essential Bosnian sweet traditions
